content:
To run a file as an administrator using cmd, you can use the "runas" command. The syntax is as follows:

runas /user:<username> <filepath>

For example, to run a file called "example.exe" located in the C:\Program Files directory as the administrator, you would use the following command:

runas /user:administrator "C:\Program Files\example.exe"

You will be prompted to enter the administrator's password before the file is executed.
